results.title: Aclà
results.creator_credit: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, Pentafilm, Nova Films and CineEuropa '92
results.brief_description: In the 1930s and 11-year-old Sicilian boy, Acla, is sold to a sulphur miner, and for five years from Monday to Saturday, the boy is made the miner’s property, spending the whole week down the mine, going home on Saturday and Sunday. There he experiences the inhuman world of the sulphur mines, the stifling, choking tunnels and the physical and sexual violence that everybody indulges in by unspoked agreement. He attempts several escapes, but each time he is caught and beaten. Until the last attempt, when finally he reaches the sea. And freedom… In Italian language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, Pentafilm, Nova Films and CineEuropa ‘92

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Trade routes
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Commonwealth Dept of Aboriginal Affairs and Richard Guthrie
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Rainbow serpent”.
Professor Eric Willmot describes the ancient trade routes set up by the Aborigines all over the continent, the evidence for their existence and the effect they had on the structure of Aboriginal society. 100,000 years ago the first people came to Australia. A thriving trade in stone age technology, and in red ochre began. The law of ancient Australia, of beholdenness, and all its implications, still followed by tribal Aborigines today, was derived from this trade. But the trade routes also carried destruction in the form of disease and white settlers. Yet many are still used, albeit using different methods of transport and trading new commodities.

results.title: Rolf Harris: How to Draw Fun Cartoons
results.brief_description: Yes, it’s the distinctive cartoons, drawings and humour of the unstoppable Rolf Harris and it’s Rolf Harris in person taking you through your very own “learn to draw” lesson. “You can draw”, says Rolf Harris. “We all can. It’s just a matter of knowing that you can draw your way”. How to draw fun cartoons, will give you as much pleasure watching as it will when you try out Rolf’s methods for yourself. Don’t say “I can’t draw” anymore, let Rolf Harris show you how.

results.title: Australia's Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80's
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, South Pacific Films and Pom Oliver
results.brief_description: A music video documentary showcasing the best of Australia’s popular music in the eighties. Features the music of Split Enz, Australian Crawl, INXS, No Fixed Address, Cold Chisel and Icehouse. Includes interviews with celebrities such as Michael Hutchence, Neil and Tim Finn, James Reyne and Grace Knight.

results.title: More Winners : His Master's Ghost
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Margaret McDonald
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
A vacation music camp at an old country estate brings together a group of children, not all of whom have come with music foremost in their minds. The estate has an air of mystery about it and when mention is made of a live-in ghost, some of the children, especially Flea, become fascinated. Flea’s obsession in tracking down the ghost and playing practical jokes leads him into constant trouble with the teachers. Meanwhile, Jason, a rather serious boy is, against some purist opposition, trying to get his Concerto for the Rock Group and Orchestra, which has a very difficult solo passage, played in the final concert. Between these two stories floats the estate’s caretaker, a figure of mystery and fascination. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Steve Jodrell, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Margaret McDonald

results.title: More Winners : Mr Edmund
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Anthony Buckley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
Twelve year old Cherry Williams befriends Mr Edmund, who is one of the rather impoverished guests at her mother’s boarding house. Mr Edmund has a dream that one day she will be a lawyer. Cherry’s mother believes these are foolish dreams and urges the two of them to grow up. Mr Edmund, Cherry and her younger brother, Sam, save old Mrs Finkel from a bag snatcher. She is grateful and when she hears of Mr Edmund’s dream insists on hiring the Opera House Concert Hall for him for one night. They are all to participate in the concert. On the big day Mr Edmund, Cherry and Sam learn that Mrs Finkel is dying in hospital and that she did not really have the money to hire the Concert hall. Cherry thinks that her mother has been right all along: dreams are for kids. Mr Edmund, however, is determined to have his moment on the Concert Hall stage partly in memory of Mrs Finkel but also as a celebration of hope. Rated: G

results.title: More Winners : His master's ghost (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
A group of children are brought together to holiday at a music camp. set at an old estate, rumoured to have its own live-in ghost. One of the children, Flea, becomes obsessed with tracking down the phantom. Meanwhile Jason is attempting to get his Concerto for Rock Group and Orchestra approved of. During all this, strange things begin to happen whenever the estate’s mysterious care-taker is around.

results.title: More Winners [Series]
results.brief_description: A second series of highly acclaimed television programs for children. ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

results.title: More Winners : The Journey
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Richard Mason
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
Justus Zukermann, a wealthy prospector, lives with his 12 year old daughter, Ada on a windswept mountain plateau. Since Ada’s mother died, Martha and her step-daughter, Agnes, have been employed to run the household. One day Justus is fatally injured in a fall. Before he dies he orders Ada to journey south to find her true inheritance. Agnes is to accompany her. Martha (who is in fact a witch) has for years envied Justus’ wealth. She determines to secure the hidden fortune for herself and orders Agnes to kill Ada and steal the map once they reach the forest. Agnes is unable to kill Ada and the two girls are drawn together. After several adventures the girls find a secret cave, unearth the buried treasure and a letter from Justus, which makes the purpose of their journey very clear. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Oehr, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Richard Mason
